summary.para: Unlike a normal texture, a dynamic texture has direct access to it's pixel data
Use a dynamic texture if you need flexible access to read and write pixel data
A dynamic texture can be convert to a normal texture and vise-versa (do not forget to dispose the dynamic texture when you are done with it)

member.name: P:Glaives.Graphics.DynamicTexture.Size
member.summary: The dimensions of the dynamic texture

member.summary: Create a new dynamic texture

The height of the dynamic texture

member.name: M:Glaives.Graphics.DynamicTexture.#ctor(Glaives.Graphics.Texture)
member.summary: Create a new dynamic texture
member.param: A texture to copy the pixel data from

summary.para: Read the RGBA bytes from the dynamic texture and convert them to colors
The length of the color array is (Size.X * Size.Y)
Read all the RGBA bytes from the dynamic texture
The length of the byte array is (Size.X * Size.Y * 4)

member.name: M:Glaives.Graphics.DynamicTexture.ReadColors(Glaives.GameFramework.IntRect)

summary.para: Read the RGBA bytes from the dynamic texture and convert them to colors
The length of the color array will be (region.Width * region.Height) unless a part of the region falls of the texture, the region will then size down to fit the texture exactly

member.param: The region on the dynamic texture to read from

summary.para: The amount of draw calls to the GPU needed to render the level
Actors with the same Shader, Texture, BlendMode and DrawLayer will be batched together into the same draw call

summary.para: A texture exists only on the GPU and is therefor not as flexible as a dynamic texture
Use a dynamic texture if you want access and/or modify the pixel data on the CPU
A dynamic texture can be converted to a texture and vise-versa (do not forget to dispose the dynamic texture when you are done with it)

member.summary: The way the texture is wrapped outside of the texture coordinates

member.summary: Create new texture create options

The way the texture is wrapped outside of the texture coordinates

member.name: T:Glaives.Graphics.TextureFilterMode
member.summary: The way the texture is filtered

member.name: F:Glaives.Graphics.TextureFilterMode.Smooth
member.summary: For smoother textures

member.name: F:Glaives.Graphics.TextureFilterMode.Sharp
member.summary: For pixel-perfect textures

member.name: T:Glaives.Graphics.TextureWrapMode
member.summary: The way the texture is sampled outside the coordinate range of 0 to 1

member.name: F:Glaives.Graphics.TextureWrapMode.Repeat
member.summary: The integer part of the coordinate is ignored and a repeated pattern is formed

member.name: F:Glaives.Graphics.TextureWrapMode.MirroredRepeat
member.summary: Same as Repeat but it will be mirrored when the integer part of the coordinate is odd

member.name: F:Glaives.Graphics.TextureWrapMode.ClampToEdge
member.summary: The coordinate will be clamped between 0 and 1

member.name: F:Glaives.Graphics.TextureWrapMode.ClampToBorder
member.summary: The coordinates that fall outside the range will be given a border

summary.para: A view is used to project the geometry onto the viewport

members.member: \brief Get the number of registered touch devices.
